fields.help_text: The URL to the HashiCorp Vault
fields.label: Server URL

fields.help_text: The access token used to authenticate to the Vault server
fields.label: Token

fields.help_text: The CA certificate used to verify the SSL certificate of the Vault server
fields.label: CA Certificate

fields.help_text: The Role ID for AppRole Authentication
fields.label: AppRole role_id

fields.help_text: The Secret ID for AppRole Authentication
fields.label: AppRole secret_id

fields.help_text: Name of the namespace to use when authenticate and retrieve secrets
fields.label: Namespace name (Vault Enterprise only)

fields.help_text: The Role for Kubernetes Authentication. This is the named role, configured in Vault server, for AWX pod auth policies. see https://www.vaultproject.io/docs/auth/kubernetes#configuration
fields.label: Kubernetes role

fields.help_text: The Authentication path to use if one isn't provided in the metadata when linking to an input field. Defaults to 'approle'
fields.label: Path to Auth

metadata.help_text: The path to the secret stored in the secret backend e.g, /some/secret/. It is recommended that you use the secret backend field to identify the storage backend and to use this field for locating a specific secret within that store. However, if you prefer to fully identify both the secret backend and one of its secrets using only this field, join their locations into a single path without any additional separators, e.g, /location/of/backend/some/secret.
metadata.label: Path to Secret

metadata.help_text: The path where the Authentication method is mounted e.g, approle
metadata.label: Path to Auth

metadata.help_text: The name of the role used to sign.
metadata.label: Role Name

metadata.help_text: Valid principals (either usernames or hostnames) that the certificate should be signed for.
metadata.label: Valid Principals
